chapter.title: Bug Tracking Systems
chapter.para: Introduce bug tracking, the Debian BTS, and Malone.

sect1.title: Bug Tracking
sect1.para: One thing that you will almost certainly face as a packager is a bug, either in the software itself or in your packaging. Packaging bugs are often fairly easy and straightforward to fix. However, as packagers often act as the initial contact for software bugs for the users of their distribution they also many time implement temporary fixes and are responsible for forwarding software bugs and fixes to the original (upstream) authors. In order to track these bugs (both software and packaging) many distributions have developed bug tracking systems to manage the bug reports and notify the package maintainers and reporters of changes.
